JOINT STOCK.Definition: owned by a group of people who are part-owners and receive a share of the profits

CHARTER.Definition: official document or statement of their rights

OUTWARD.Definition: relating to how people would see it

GRAND PLAN.Definition: a large, ambitious and impressive in extent or scope plan

WOVEN.Definition: made by hand using needle and thread

IMBALANCE.Definition: difference, the state of them not being equal

EXEMPTION.Definition: permission not to pay them, exclusion

TENSIONS.Definition: a situation of bad relations or hostilities

CULMINATED.Definition: reached the point of highest development

CLERK.Definition: a person who worked in an office

CUNNING.Definition: cleverness and the ability to use tricks to achieve his goals

FATE.Definition: what would happen in the future

KICKING OUT.Definition: forcing them to leave, throwing out

THE GOLD STANDARD.Definition: the system where the country's currency or paper money had a value directly linked to gold

GOLD RESERVES.Definition: quantities of gold held by a central bank to support the country's currency

SELF-SUFFICIENT.Definition: self-supporting, self-reliant, not needing outside help

PROLIFIC.Definition: including a great number of possessions

ABUNDANCE.Definition: the situation in which there were more than enough possessions

POPPIES.Definition: plants with red flowers and black seeds

EXTORTION.Definition: getting money using force or power

RANSACKED.Definition: had their belongings taken or damaged

BOTTOM LINE.Definition: final line in their financial accounts

HARVEST.Definition: period of gathering or collecting the grown plants

PUSHED THINGS OVER THE EDGE.Definition: put them in an extremely difficult situation

MALTREATMENT.Definition: extremely bad or cruel behaviour towards them

CASTE.Definition: system of dividing the Indian society into classes

MAKING THEM OFF LIMITS.Definition: making them not possible to be used by

ROSE UP.Definition: took part in a rebellion or started resisting

TORTURED.Definition: caused extreme pain and suffering as punishment

REBELS.Definition: people who had taken part in the resistance movement

GOT TO GRIPS.Definition: began to understand how to deal with it

DOCKLANDS.Definition: the area containing the city's docks or ports

TRACES.Definition: signs or marks of its existence

OVERSIGHT.Definition: mistake, unintentional failure to do something

IN PURSUIT OF.Definition: in order to achieve or get

IN A LEAGUE OF ITS OWN.Definition: more extreme than anyone else at doing this

SHED SOME LIGHT ON.Definition: provided some information or explanation about
